derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French poser (verb), from late Latin pausare 'to pause', which replaced Latin ponere 'to place'. The noun dates from the early 19th cent
early 16th cent.: shortening of obsolete appose, from Old French aposer, variant of oposer 'oppose'

encyclopedia.content: "pose"翻译为姿势，在模特儿行业或演艺圈经常被提起。模特儿拍照、走台的时候都要摆"pose"。尽管现时提倡自然的姿态，但这并不意味着她们可以甩开臂膀迈鸭步，再自然也还是"摆"出来的。所以搔首弄姿、矫揉造作等等在这里不一定是贬义词，优劣之分只在于摆pose的技艺以及是否符合客户的要求。

entry.tran: 产生（问题）；造成（威胁、危险等）
entry.def: If something poses a problem or a danger, it is the cause of that problem or danger.

example.ex: This could pose a threat to jobs in the coal industry...
example.tran: 这可能会给煤炭产业的就业造成威胁。

example.ex: His ill health poses serious problems for the future.
example.tran: 他身体不好，对将来造成严重的隐患。

entry.def: If you pose a question, you ask it. If you pose an issue that needs considering, you mention the issue.

example.ex: When I finally posed the question, 'Why?' he merely shrugged.
example.tran: 当我最后问“为什么”时，他只是耸了耸肩。

example.ex: ...the moral issues posed by new technologies.
example.tran: 新技术带来的道德问题

entry.def: If you pose as someone, you pretend to be that person in order to deceive people.

example.ex: The team posed as drug dealers to trap the ringleaders.
example.tran: 该队队员装扮成毒品贩子，诱捕罪犯头目。

entry.tran: 摆姿势（以供人摄影或绘画）
entry.def: If you pose for a photograph or painting, you stay in a particular position so that someone can photograph you or paint you.

example.ex: Before going into their meeting the six foreign ministers posed for photographs.
example.tran: 开会前，6位外交部长合影留念。

entry.def: You can say that people are posing when you think that they are behaving in an insincere or exaggerated way because they want to make a particular impression on other people.

example.ex: He criticized them for dressing outrageously and posing pretentiously.
example.tran: 他批评她们衣着暴露而且矫揉造作。

entry.def: A pose is a particular way that you stand, sit, or lie, for example when you are being photographed or painted.

example.ex: We have had several preliminary sittings in various poses.
example.tran: 我们进行了几次预拍摄，摆了各种不同的造型。

entry.def: A pose is an insincere or exaggerated way of behaving that is intended to make a particular impression on other people.

example.ex: In many writers modesty is a pose, but in Ford it seems to have been genuine.
example.tran: 很多作家都是故作谦虚，但福特却似乎表里如一。

means.word_mean: 1. affected manners intended to impress others;
2. a posture assumed by models for photographic or artistic purposes
3. a deliberate pretense or exaggerated display
2. assume a posture as for artistic purposes;

sentences.sentence: "We don't know the woman who posed for Leonardo so often"

means.word_mean: 3. pretend to be someone you are not; sometimes with fraudulent intentions;
4. behave affectedly or unnaturally in order to impress others;

sentences.sentence: "Don't pay any attention to him--he is always posing to impress his peers!"
"She postured and made a total fool of herself"

means.word_mean: 5. put into a certain place or abstract location;

sentences.sentence: "Set the dogs on the scent of the missing children"

means.word_mean: 6. be a mystery or bewildering to;

pose放→n.姿势,姿态 v.造成,提出,摆姿势,佯装
propose[v.计划, 建议, 向……提议, 求[婚] v.打算, 求婚]+al表名词→n.提议,建议;求婚

Sentence.sentence: In many cases, screening can lead to surgeries to remove cancer, while the cancers themselves may be slow-growing and may not pose serious health problems in patients' remaining years.

According to Blau and Kahn,Swedish-style paternal(父亲的)leave policies and flexible time arrangements pose a second threat to woman's progress:they make employers cautious about hiring woman for full-time positions at all.
They pose a serious threat to social stability.

Precisely because they were working with old-fashioned machines, George Martin and his team of engineers were forced to apply every ounce of their creativity to solve the problems posed to them by Lennon and McCartney.

你已经提出了一个难题。

sentences.en: He sat in a relaxed pose.
The President's visit to the slums was a mere pose.
sentences.cn: 总统到贫民区去访问只不过是做做样子罢了。

jushi.english: She loves to pose when men are around.
jushi.chinese: 她喜欢当男人们在周围时装腔作势。
他在那儿摆了一小时姿势。
